title: Orientation & Introduction
description: Introduce simulator rules, scoring, and campaign structure.

tasks.prompt: Candidates learn about Candidate Coins (CC), signatures, voter approval, and ballot eligibility. This module explains scoring: CC = funds, signatures = grassroots support, approval = polling.
Declare your candidacy: Are you running for President, Senate, or House?

title: Independent / Write-In Filing
description: Teach filing requirements for independents and write-ins.

tasks.prompt: Independents must submit an Application of Candidacy with the TX Secretary of State. They may pay a filing fee or collect petition signatures. Deadlines differ: May (independent) vs August (write-in).
Which TWO options are valid ways to file as an independent/write-in candidate?
tasks.correctAnswer: Pay filing fee, Collect valid signatures
